messages.content: {"mitigation_clause": "Each Party shall receive a share of the Net Profits in proportion to its Capital Contribution, after the deduction of operating expenses, taxes, and a reserve of 10% for future reinvestment. The aggregate profit share for any party shall not exceed 40% of Net Profits in any fiscal year, and any request for additional distributions shall require written consent of the other Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld."}

Here is a revised version of the clause that addresses the identified risks:

**Mitigated Profit Allocation Clause:**
"Each Party shall receive a share of the Net Profits in proportion to its Capital Contribution, after the deduction of operating expenses, taxes, and a reserve of 10% for future reinvestment. The aggregate profit share for any party shall not exceed 40% of Net Profits in any fiscal year, and any request for additional distributions shall require written consent of the other Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld."

This wording introduces a reasonable cap and a consent mechanism, which should reduce exposure to the type of liability observed in the Texas dispute.
